class.name: EditorProperty
class.brief_description: Custom control to edit properties for adding into the inspector.
class.description: This control allows property editing for one or multiple properties into [EditorInspector]. It is added via [EditorInspectorPlugin].

method.name: add_focusable
method.description: If any of the controls added can gain keyboard focus, add it here. This ensures that focus will be restored if the inspector is refreshed.

method.name: emit_changed
method.description: If one or several properties have changed, this must be called. [code]field[/code] is used in case your editor can modify fields separately (as an example, Vector3.x). The [code]changing[/code] argument avoids the editor requesting this property to be refreshed (leave as [code]false[/code] if unsure).

method.name: get_edited_property
method.description: Gets the edited property. If your editor is for a single property (added via [method EditorInspectorPlugin.parse_property]), then this will return the property.

method.name: get_tooltip_text
method.description: Override if you want to allow a custom tooltip over your property.

method.name: set_bottom_editor
method.description: Adds controls with this function if you want them on the bottom (below the label).

method.name: update_property
method.description: When this virtual function is called, you must update your editor.

members.member: Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property is checkable.
Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property is checked.
Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property can be deleted by the user.
Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property must draw with error color. This is used for editable children's properties.
Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property can add keys for animation.
Set this property to change the label (if you want to show one).
Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property is read-only.

signal.name: multiple_properties_changed
signal.description: Emit it if you want multiple properties modified at the same time. Do not use if added via [method EditorInspectorPlugin.parse_property].

signal.name: object_id_selected
signal.description: Used by sub-inspectors. Emit it if what was selected was an Object ID.

signal.name: property_changed
signal.description: Do not emit this manually, use the [method emit_changed] method instead.

signal.name: property_checked
signal.description: Emitted when a property was checked. Used internally.

signal.name: property_deleted
signal.description: Emitted when a property was deleted. Used internally.

signal.name: property_keyed
signal.description: Emit it if you want to add this value as an animation key (check for keying being enabled first).

signal.name: property_keyed_with_value
signal.description: Emit it if you want to key a property with a single value.

signal.name: resource_selected
signal.description: If you want a sub-resource to be edited, emit this signal with the resource.
